content: There should be a statement about the ambiguous case of 24, do we expect "24:24 24:42" or "00:00"
This contribution hasn’t received enough positive votes from the community. The "REVERSE" option has therefore been deactivated.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: it's a great fit for clash of code

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Testcases are well defined, I tried solving it first by only looking only at testcases and it's easily solveable this way.

I think there's a misunderstood in the statement when you say: "Your task is to print the valid combinations separated by spaces" 
By valid conbination of 12 I undertand: 12:12, 12:21,21:12, 21:21.


But it is totally deductible just by looking at the test-cases.

I would be a more challenging (interesting?) problem if we had to output times such that x+y = n.

I have issues with the wording of the problem:

Statement:
There is already an example after the constraints, no reason to put it in the statement. But the first test case should be one with different digits like Test 2.

You ask to print the combinations but which ones? It could be xy or hh:mm. We have to deduce from the examples what you want. Something like "Print all the valid times for the given number...".

Why print 'NONE'? Just print nothing if there is nothing.
Also why separated by spaces? One answer per line would align better.

Input/Ouput/Constraint:
You have to describe the input and ouput, not give an example. Not all input are '11'...
What is N in the constraints? It is not defined in the input nor in the output.
Why N could be 1000? 
I think you have to forget N and talk about x and y.

Test cases:
Because you said the result must be unique, I put them in a set. But because of that, the order of my answer is different from the expected order.
Why '10:10 10:01' is valid but not '10:01 10:10'?
An improvement would be to ask for valid times in chronological order.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Test cases and validators have been fixed.

I have updated your validators so that they are different than the test cases (but similar) and changed 001 to 01. Your solution still seems to work for all cases, so I kept it. If you like this version more, you can keep it :)
Test and validator should all be different. Aside from that, I think it's an interesting puzzle.
Test and validator must be different !
I like the Idea, but it would be better if you explained more what you are expecting from the user. For example, you didn't explained that the valid combinations should not repeat.

Problem is nice but I observed few things.

1) You never described the output format in case multiple answers exist in "Output" section. I missed it even though you mentioned in Goal.
2) In test case 5 how the input contains 3 digits (001) where as you mentioned in the description that "Mirrored time number is a number of two digit x and y...". It contradicts. Please fix this.
3) Can we update the description something like this:

"""
Mirrored time number is a number of two digits x and y which if we write like xy:xy or xy:yx we get a valid time in hh:mm.

Your task is to print the valid combinations separated by spaces. If no such combination exists print 'NONE'.

"""
It looks interesting!
i am very near, have solved all cases exept last need just 10 more minutes, gotta go now , will do it later
ty !

Ouh that's nice i hope you enjoy it, please upvote it if you like it.
 Thank You
Thank you IIDimov18 (y)

Thank you for your time and effort to evaluate this contribution and to give me your remarks, really appreciate it.
i have already updated the description as you mentioned.
for the multiple answer there is the example of 12 => 12:12 12:21
and for the 001 the leading zero's or absence of a second number you can replace it by one zero for example : 3 = 03 = 000003 leading zero's in decimal format are none sense so that's why 001 is treated like 01 = > 01:01 01:10

Thank you for sharing 
Best regards
yeah i've tried to make them different by i got an error and didn't understand why :/
Thank you Smelty ;) good job
No problem :)
I think it is time to publish it :)
How can i do it please ?
While editing contribution make it Ready from WIP.
